intro: Cyanus pullatus, commonly known as the blueweed or bachelor's buttons, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its vibrant blue or purple flower heads, which are actually composite flowers made up of numerous tiny florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for garden cultivation. Cyanus pullatus is also known for its historical use in traditional medicine and as a source of natural dyes.
